desc.p: Denotes the method for interest calculation.
Should be a valid record in INTEREST.BASIS.
Underlying Price / Exchange price of the two currencies.
It is a NOINPUT field.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is populated from DX.TRADE.
The type of option defined.
It holds two values either CALL or PUT based on the trade.
Its gets value from DX.PRICE.SET.
CLOSING - END OF EXCHANGE: Prices are updated during the end of exchange processing.
CURRENT - ON-LINE: Prices can be updated online using a verify application DX.RV.CHECK.PRICES.
If the revaluation occurs during End of Exchange then PRICE.SET holds the value CLOSING.
If the revaluation occurs Online then PRICE.SET holds the value CURRENT.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
The price is calculated as Internal number of ticks * tick value for strike price.
The new price in which revaluation should be done.
This is used internally as the price as which to calculate the internal price.
Key to DX.VOLATALITY.
The key for this file is CONTRACT.CODE-MATURITY.
This is the user field value.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
The current system date.
It is a NOINPUT field.
It holds the quote currency price in which revaluation should be done.
This represents the rate of change of the value with respect to the volatility of the underlying asset.
Greek value generated as part of the option pricing.
The User Field Price is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It is a NOINPUT field.
Record id of the transaction being priced.
It is a NOINPUT field.
It is the contract currency of the trade.
Its value is populated from DX.TRADE.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It is the internal price in standard T24 price format.
Its value is calculated as
INT.PRICE = Internal number of ticks * tick value for Futures price or Option premium.
The secondary internal rate for the secondary customer.
The rate at which the price of a derivative changes relative to a change in the risk-free rate of interest.
Rho measures the sensitivity of an option or options portfolio to a change in interest rate.
Values are available for both Call and Put options.
Greek value generated as part of the option pricing.
Populate this field for reporting purposes. The field allows for Regulatory, Internal, or other reporting requirements on the contract to the appropriate body/department.
Value populated from DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
The internal rate for the primary customer.
Indicates whether the contract is a interest rate contract.
This is the key to this DX.MARKET.PRICE record.
The record key comprises the following attributes:

price set * exotic type (if applicable) / contract / currency / maturity date / call or put (only for options) / strike price (only for options) * exotic option data, delimited by '/' (for exotic options only).
The currency of the quoted price in which valuation should be done.
If QUOTE.CCY is Null then it takes the PRICE.CCY whose value is defined in the DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
It is a NOINPUT field.
It specifies the source application.
It is NOINPUT field whose value is got from the DX.TRADE.
The delivery period or prompt date of the contract transacted.
The date must be greater than the Trade Date.
Price source describes the type of pricing model to be used for revaluation.
Its value should be a valid record in DX.PRICE.SOURCE.
The price source is also setup in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It is NOINPUT field whose value is got from the DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
The number of decimal places for the price quote. This also changes the number of decimal places in the multi-value set of Price Band.
This is the Underlying Internal Price.
It is a NOINPUT field.
Identifier code used by the Regulatory Body, Internal or other reporting system for the contract.
Value populated from DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
The current system time.
This represents the rate of change of the option price with respect to the underlying asset.
Greek value generated as part of the option pricing.
It is a NOINPUT field.
The User Field Name gets value from DX.TRADE.
A measure of the rate of decline in the value of an option due to the passage of time.
Theta can also be referred to as the time decay on the value of an option.
Theta is part of the group of measures known as the "Greeks" which is used in options pricing.
Values are available for both Call and Put options.
This represents the rate of change of the delta with respect to the underlying asset.
Greek value generated as part of the option pricing.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It accepts three values namely : FUTURE,OPTION,STOCK.
It is a NOINPUT field.
It denotes the time to mature the contract.
A variable in option pricing formulas showing the extent to which the return of the underlying asset will fluctuate between now and the option's expiration.
Values are available for both Call and Put options.
Used to input the volatilities to be used by the option pricing models.
It is NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It is the External Strike Price.
The price at which an option holder has the right to buy (Call Options) or sell (Put Options) the underlying instrument, or to cash-settle the option if appropriate, to exercise the option.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.CONTRACT.MASTER whose contract is traded.
The unit of measure relative to which the price is quoted.
It is used for price related description.
It is a NOINPUT field.
The rate of exchange between the price currency and the quote currency.
It is a NOINPUT field whose value is got from the DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
It is the contract specification currency as set by the relative exchange. This is the user-defined alpha currency code.
Limit related to reporting/regulatory procedure named in GEN.DATA.NAME.
The alternate index id related to ALT.IND.NAME.
Its value is got from DX.PARAMETER.
It is a NOINPUT field.
Represents the alternate index name.
Identifies the alternate for contracts in this system. i.e. CUSIP, ISIN etc.
Identifies a list of possible alternate ID names that can be used to identify the the contract.
It is NOINPUT field whose value is got from DX.TRADE.
It holds single value either CALL or PUT based on the trade.
It is a NOINPUT field.
The Contract CODE for the trade, as per the information in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
Its value should be a valid record in DX.CONTRACT.MASTER.
Gets value from DX.TRADE.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
Help Text for this field is unavailable. Please refer to the T24 User Guides for further information.
